availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
The State of Ohio
Hamilton County } S S

Staughton Lynd being duly sworn says that he will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of his station under his appointment and commission from the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky as Commissioner of deeds for the State of Kentucky said commission bearing date April 14" 1863, & said Lynd residing in the State of Ohio

I hereby certify that the foregoing affidavit was this day subscribed & sworn to before me by said Staughton Lynd who is to me well known. Witness my hand and seal of office this this 17th day of April A D 1863

John H. Ewing
Notary Public
Ham. Co. Ohio

Ohio
Oath of Office
S. Lynd
Comr of Deeds
Filed Apr 18. 1863.
